title: OODA Loop Basics
content: OODA stands for Observe, Orient, Decide, Act. First, gather current facts. Second, interpret them within context. Third, choose a course of action. Fourth, execute and return to Observe. Speed comes from practice, not skipping steps. Faster OODA loops give you advantage in dynamic situations.

mcq.question: In the OODA loop, what happens during 'Orient'?

options.B: You interpret observations within context to understand meaning
